newsitem.title: USA: No political pick as next US forest head-Sen Craig.
newsitem.headline: No political pick as next US forest head-Sen Craig.

text.p: The Clinton administration should choose the next Forest Service chief "from the ranks of forestry professionals" in the agency and not give the job to a political appointee, Senator Larry Craig said Thursday.
Craig, Idaho Republican, also said in a statement that he hoped the administration would consult with lawmakers to ensure the new chief would have a good working relationship with Congress.
"I will definitely hold hearings early next Congress on what direction the new chief plans on taking the Forest Service," said Craig, an Agriculture subcommittee chairman.
Craig was disappointed with Jack Ward Thomas' decision to resign as Forest Service chief.

"Jack was the first chief chosen outside of the traditional path of Forest Service professionals," he said. "Thus, like him, his successor could be a political appointee. This administration should return to tradition and choose the next Forest Service chief from the ranks of ranks of forestry professionals at the Forest Service."
Along with being a career employee, the next chief should have field experience in managing forests, knowledge of natural resources and supervisory experience, Craig said.
